quotes.quote: This detachmentmust not be mere amputation; everything which is shaken off must be simultaneously found again at a higher level.
Detachment, sometimes it's necessary in order to restore your sanity. Your peace of mind.
Detachment is not giving up the things in this world, but accepting the fact and to be continuously aware that nothing is permanent.
Your heart must become a sea of love. Your mind must become a river of detachment.
Detached action is unselfish work.
Detachment is an art of enjoying something while always being open to the possibility of losing it someday.
Detachment and involvement: the artist must have both. The link between them is compassion. It has taken me over fifty years to get a glimmer of what this means.
Detachment is not about refusing to feel or not caring or turning away from those you love. Detachment is profoundly honest, grounded firmly in the truth of what is.
Always remember that you were once alone, and the crowd you see in your life today are just as unecessary as when you were alone.
Detachment does not mean non-involvement. You can be deeply involved but not entangled.
To spare oneself from grief at all cost can be achieved only at the price of total detachment.
Our detachments move us toward freedom and death.
One has to remain detached in order to triumph over others.
There is no detachment where there is no pain. And there is no pain endured without hatred or lying unless detachment is present too.
The detached observer's view is one window on the world.
Detachment consists in refraining from letting our possessions possess us.
Only in the stillness of detachment can the soul yield up her secrets.
There is nothing harder to come by than detachment and solitude; and nothing more important.
Detachment is the ultimate pleasure.
Detachment is not that you should own nothing. But that nothing should own you.
Detachment is the beginning of mastery.
We live in a society where detachment is almost essential.
True detachment isn't separation from life but the absolute freedom within your mind to explore living.
To be consistently effective, you must put a certain distance between yourself and what happens to you on the golf course. This is not indifference, it's detachment.
He who would be serene and pure needs but one thing, detachment.
Detachment doesn't mean you don't let the experience penetrate you. On the contrary, you let it penetrate you fully. That's how you are able to leave it.
Detachment produces a peculiar state of mind. Maybe that's the worst sentence of all, to be deprived of feeling what a human being ought to be entitled to feel.
In the face of evil, detachment is a dubious virtue.
Just a little detachment from the ego is needed.
Detachment is a plant of slow growth; if you pluck the tender plant to look for the pods, you will be disappointed.
Acquire the art of detachment, the virtue of method, and the quality of thoroughness, but above all the grace of humility.
Detachment means to not be owned by what we own.
If you truly want to be respected by people you love, you must prove to them that you can survive without them.
Compassion without detachment is attachment to the bodily platform.
